summary: The document comprises records pertaining to Giulia M. Barrow's employment and subsequent resignation from the Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) in the U.S. House of Representatives. It includes various forms and letters, such as payroll authorizations, resignation correspondence, and a resume highlighting Barrow's professional background. Additionally, the document addresses the records' classification under the Assassination Records Collection Act, noting partial postponements in information release to safeguard privacy, particularly concerning Social Security numbers.
key_findings: Giulia M. Barrow resigned from the Select Committee on Assassinations on May 15, 1977, as documented in her resignation letter and the acknowledgment by Alvin B. Lewis, Jr.
Payroll authorization forms within the document specify Barrow's employment terms, including her salary and job title.
As of December 8, 1995, the document's status was 'Postponed in Part', with certain details withheld to protect personal privacy, notably Social Security numbers.
These records are part of the JFK Assassination System and were evaluated under the Assassination Records Collection Act.
Barrow's resume details her extensive experience in secretarial and administrative positions within the U.S. House of Representatives, as well as her previous employment in the private sector.
